intro: Hessea mathewsii, commonly known as the Mathews' hessian, is a flowering plant native to the island of Maui in Hawaii. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically arranged in spikelets, a common feature among grasses. Hessea mathewsii is adapted to the dry, coastal environments of its native habitat, exhibiting drought tolerance and salt resistance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
